page.title: 07CLUBS
page.content: In the Foulridge area there are clubs and groups to suit most ages and interests.Lake Burwain,a reservoir supplying the canal,is a focus for water associated sports.The lake is spilt into an upper & lower stretch of water.The upper one is used by Colne Angling Club,and the lower one by a sailing club.Windsurfing & canoeing are other aspects of the activities held on the lower part of the lake. Nightschool classes in yoga & badminton are held in the village school during term time and an over sixties group meets in the village hall. Foulridge Cricket Club has three teams in three of the four divisions of the Craven Cricket League.Colne Golf Club in the east of the area is a nine hole course open to members only.
